Description: Fragment of tapestry roundel (single warp threads); Roundel mainly in purple wool, a mix of blue and red fibres; Design in negative on a ground hatched with undyed linen; Platform of interlacing enclosing star motifs and quatrefoils, guilloche frame; Patched in the centre with a weft-faced, plain weave red/purple cloth, edges darned together; Warp: S spun, undyed wool, c.10tpc; Weft: S spun purple wool, c.45tpc; S spun linen for soumak outlining; Edges: two plain selvedges at middle of sides, other edges cut; Sewing: originally with turned under edges hemmed in S spun Z ply linen, darning thread matches warp or weft yarn; Patch: c.9x7cm, red wool, S spun, warp-c.7tpc, weft-c.18tpc
Curator's comments: Unreg. 30 (i and ii); Similar to EA72412, EA72413, EA72414, EA72415 and EA72416; Found in 1988? In a packer in Keeper's Office; Previous location cupboard O; Information from Hero Granger-Taylor (19.3.1991)
Condition: Fair; One half fair with the other discoloured and brittle
